FIX POINT ALGORITHM¶

Created on Wed Feb 14 15:48:14 2018

@author: Diego Britez

fixepoint.fixpoint(X, tshape, U, F, z, r, maxfix)[source]¶

This function calculates the n mode for each iteration in the enrichment loop for the PGD method. The definition of each variable (such as alpha, betha, etc) that it’s used here could be found in detail in the manuscript of Lucas Lestandi doctoral thesis.

Parameters

X= Cartesian Grid.

tshape= Tensor shape.

U= (n-1) modes of the decomposition.

F= Tensor to be decomposed.

z= No convergence times counter variable.

r= Actual rank in the decomposition.

maxfix= maximun number of iterations in point fix algorithm.

Returns

R = n mode of the decomposition in the PGD decomposition method.

z = actualized number of iteration that did not converge, so:

\(z_{n}=z_{n-1}+1\) if the actual mode does not converge or

\(z_{n}=z_{n-1}\) if it has converged.
